instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ACOK low.
threads.message:
Hi!
Minor liquid damage around <CHIP>U3220</CHIP>, <CHIP>U3320</CHIP> TBT area. DCIN fluctuates slightly and ACOK is low so I have a verrrry dim green light.

DCIN - 16.5V - 16.8V
PPBUS - 12.58V
PP3V42 - 3.42V

ISL

17/18 - 3.4 Ohm
27/28 - 20.9 Ohm
ACIN - 3.8V - 3.9V (fluctuates)
ACOK - 2.5V - 2.6V (fluctuates)
ACOK in Diode - .517

Replaced <CHIP>U7001</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C7008</CAPACITOR>
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> /<TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7012</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R7011</RESISTOR> and <DIODE>D7010</DIODE>.
Replaced ISL 2X
Replaced J7000 because the plastic was broken.

There is no visible damage around SMC.

Thanks! Have good one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ACOK low.
threads.message: Resistance to GND on ACOK line? <RESISTOR>R5187</RESISTOR> checked?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ACOK low.
threads.message:
Hey Duke.

.643 MOhms on ACOK.
Resistor looked fine. Swapped just in case. Still very faint green light...
ACOK - 2.8 - 3.2V.
Getting 3.3 - 3.4 on pin 5 <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. Still very faint green.

Guess Im doing SMC on this...


Update - Replaced SMC. Same issue... Not SMC! lol.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ACOK low.
threads.message: Got it. Thanks Duke. I assume your off... Enjoy!
